Technique: PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL; FORMED BY HAND; RELIEF
Name: Terracotta bootle of Saint Menas
Description: This terracotta bottle is missing its neck and both handles and belongs to a category of bottles dedicated to Saint Menas. Pilgrims to his sanctuary in the desert near Lake Mareotis to the south of Alexandria returned with bottles filled with consecrated water. This example is decorated on both sides with a cross and a short inscription invoking the name of the saint.
